Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Sylveta Hamilton-Gonzalez, Bishop and Founder of Q Kingdom Ministries, 1313 Union Street, Brooklyn  11235.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER BARRON.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Sylveta Hamilton-Gonzalez, Bishop and Founder of Q Kingdom Ministries, 1313 Union Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11235.

Council Member Barron moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 12, 2003 be adopted and printed by Council Member Recchia.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Recchia moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  February 12, 2003 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 215-A, to amend the New York City charter, in relation to requiring the chancellor of the city school district to submit to the Council quarterly reports on the status of all school capital projects.
Items.MatterName: Veto Int. 215-A, Quarterly report on the status of Board of Ed capital projects.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Angela M. Battaglia to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment as a member of the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Angela M. Battaglia, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Christopher Kui to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Christopher Kui, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Board of Elections in the City of New York - Submitting the Certification of Election of Pedro Espada Jr., as the new Council Member of the 18th Councilmanic District, Bronx County.

Items.MatterName: Certification, Pedro Espada Jr., Council Member, CD#18, Bronx

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Addabbo:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 030138 PPQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Dispo 28 COP's QCB#10, Queens (C030138PPQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Lopez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 454 Lafayette Street, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20025242 TCM.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 454 Lafayette Street (20025242 TCM)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to amending the Administrative Code of the City of New York, in order to eradicate forest insects and forest tree diseases.
Items.MatterName: Eradicate forest insects and forest tree diseases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the collection of claims on behalf of the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Collection of claims on behalf of the city of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council of the City of New York to support the City's software and information technology industry and to support the "Buy NY" campaign of its trade association, the New York Software Industry Association; all software and information technology buyers and procurers, in private industry, the not-for-profit sector, and all levels of government, to take part in the "Buy NY" campaign by including one or more New York City producers or vendors on all evaluation lists; and all buyers and procurers in the software and information technology field, in private industry, the not-for-profit sector, and all levels of government, to support the Buy NY campaign by meeting New York City vendors and producers at the NYSIA "Buy NY" fair on Friday, March 21, 2003.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the "Buy NY Campaign"

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of ambulance service.
Items.MatterName: The provision of ambulance service.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and Legislature of New York State to meet their constitutional and statutory duty to provide counsel for indigent defendants by increasing the rates paid to assigned counsel, with no distinction between in-court and out-of-court work, index the assigned counsel rates to inflation, and eliminate the ceiling on total per case compensation, and further calling upon the Governor and Legislature to fully fund the increase in these rates.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rates paid to assigned counsel in all cases to $90 per hour, with no distinction between in-court and out-of-court work,

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to hold an oversight hearing on the planning, procedures and practices of the Department of Homeless Services in siting homeless shelters in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Planning, procedures and practices of the Department of Homeless Services in siting homeless shelters in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing on the efficiency of air filtration technologies with respect to Local Law 47 of 2002 (The Smoke Free Air Act).
Items.MatterName: Efficiency of air filtration technologies with respect to Local Law 47 of 2002 (The Smoke Free Air Act).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor and the Human Resources Administration (HRA) to increase food stamp participation by providing help to applicants on their first visit to HRA offices and by making HRA office hours more flexible for working families.
Items.MatterName: Mayor and HRA to increase food stamp participation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the city to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.
Items.MatterName: City to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the consumer bill of rights regarding tax preparers.
Items.MatterName: Consumer bill of rights regarding tax preparers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a deposit program for all primary and rechargeable batteries.
Items.MatterName: Deposit program for all primary and rechargeable batteries.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the enactment of New York State Senate bill, S.1008, that would establish a Metropolitan Transportation Authority operating oversight committee which would be responsible for reviewing all financial records and operating budget proposals of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
Items.MatterName: Establish an MTA operating oversight committee.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to utilize its in-house employees for design, engineering and other major initiatives rather than rely on outside consultants.
Items.MatterName: MTA to utilize its in-house employees for design, engineering and other major initiatives.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York, which provides mentally ill prison inmates with all the benefits of an adequate discharge plan prior to and/or immediately upon release from City prisons or jails, as mandated in Justice Richard Braun's 2000 ruling, which ruling was unanimously affirmed by the New York State Supreme Court, Appellate Division, First Department, and denied leave to appeal to the New York Court of Appeals.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Support of the proposed landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the definition of fill material.
Items.MatterName: Definition of fill material.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the allocation of funds from the E911 system surcharge.
Items.MatterName: Allocation of funds from the E911 system surcharge.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill 01755, a bill to provide a two hundred dollar personal income tax credit to volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers who have completed all required training courses as required by the state of New York; or, if the Legislature chooses not to pass this bill, it should, at the minimum, grant the City of New York the authority to provide this credit to volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Personal income tax credit to volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers. (A.01755)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to adopt S.202, which would require hospitals to provide information on emergency contraception and, upon request, provide emergency contraception to rape survivors during emergency treatment.
Items.MatterName: Require hospitals to provide information on emergency contraception.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Supreme Court's recent decision to review Lawrence v. Texas, a case which challenges the constitutionality of Texas's Homosexual Conduct law, and urging the Court to reconsider and reject its ruling in Bowers v. Hardwick by extending to gays and lesbians the same Constitutional protections afforded to heterosexual couples.
Items.MatterName: Constitutionality of Texas's Homosexual Conduct Law

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt A.5796 which would legalize the possession, manufacture, sale, administration, delivery, dispensing and distribution of marijuana in connection with medical use for certified patients.
Items.MatterName: Legalize marijuana in connection with medical use for certified patients. (A.5796)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senators Maltese, Padavan and Velella, S.74, and Assembly Member Markey, A.142, "AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to hours of operation of convenience stores".
Items.MatterName: Hours of operation of convenience stores (S.74, A.142)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senators Maltese and Padavan, S.91, and Assembly Members M. Cohen and Markey, et al, A.642, "AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to hours of operation of retail mercantile establishments".
Items.MatterName: Hours of operation of retail mercantile establishments (S.91, A.642)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1182, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.2844, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs of the city of New York who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Deputy sheriffs who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties (S.1182, A.2844)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1698, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.3920, "AN ACT to amend the penal law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving the firearm license fee for certain retired officers, sheriffs, undersheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Waiving the firearm license fee for certain retired officers, sheriffs, undersheriffs and deputy sheriffs (S.1698, A.3920)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1699, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.3919, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the detective bureau".
Items.MatterName: Composition of the detective bureau (S.1699, A.3919)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1776, and Assembly Member Nolan, A.3934, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to Theodore M. Renz, sole heir-at-law and distributee of former owners Rudolph Renz and Johanna Renz".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Theodore Renz, Queens (S.1776, A.3934)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill, introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1830, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits".
Items.MatterName: Eligibility of uniformed personnel of the NYC department of correction for ordinary disability benefits (S.1830)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.1843, and Assembly Member Pheffer, et al, A.4210, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disability cases".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disability cases (S.1843, A.4210)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member McLaughlin, A.2458, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to residence districts".
Items.MatterName: Residence Districts (A.2458)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to dumping snow and ice from piers.
Items.MatterName: Dumping snow and ice from piers.

Items.MatterName: Storage of salt for purposes of snow removal.

Items.Title: Parks and Recreation
Resolutions
Discussion of Resolutions
THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER PEDRO ESPADA JR. TAKING HIS OATH OF OFFICE.
Roll Call

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to require certain establishments where weapons violations have taken place to adopt security measures as recommended by the New York City Police Department.
Items.MatterName: Require certain establishments where weapons violations have taken place to adopt security measures.

Items.Title:
By Council Members Davis and Boyland:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20030027 PPK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 4 City Owned Properties, Brooklyn (20030027PPK)

Items.Title: Roll Call

Resolution calling on the government of the United States to make all efforts to work through the United Nations Security Council in a manner that would reaffirm our nation's commitment to the rule of law and the primacy of human rights in our international relationships, and to take all appropriate steps toward securing the participation of other nations and international bodies in the effort to ensure that Iraq does not possess biological, chemical or nuclear weapons and toward promoting human rights for all the people of Iraq; and further calling on the government of the United States to work through the United Nations Security Council and with other nations to ensure the unimpeded access of United Nations weapons inspectors to all areas of and facilities in Iraq and to ensure that the inspectors be given a full and fair opportunity to conduct their efforts in accordance with United Nations Security Council resolutions; and further calling upon the Council of the City of New York to oppose a pre-emptive military attack on Iraq unless it is demonstrated that Iraq poses a real and imminent threat to the security and safety of the United States or its allies or unless other options for achieving compliance with United Nations resolutions calling for the elimination of weapons of mass destruction and the means for their development have failed.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by the Council by voice vote; the following 17 Council Members  objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Addabbo Jr., Avella, Felder, Fidler, Gallagher, Gennaro, Katz, Lanza, McMahon, Nelson, Provenzano, Recchia Jr., Sears, Vallone Jr., Weprin, Oddo and Rivera.
Items.MatterName: Oppose the Congressional Resolution allowing President George W. Bush to unilaterally declare war against Iraq.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum)

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
